Posts.Content: Hi jane I searched zoladex and exemestane and found you! I know you posted two years but wondered if you had any advise, I have been on these drugs since April and all of a sudden in July I became very achy.  All my joints are painful and I become very stiff. I swim go to the gym and attend yoga classes.  I’ve been taking glucosamine since August but have noticed no improvement. Did you or do you still suffer with joint pains?  I hope you are well, anita
Posts.Title: Exercising after treatment

Posts.Content: Thank you I will do. ive read many of your posts and find them helpful, honest and reassuring.
Posts.Title: Exercising after treatment

Posts.Content: Thanks. I have been reading people’s posts all year now and find it very comforting.  Family and friends have been amazing but they just don’t understand. When you feel like you can move on something else hits you and with me it’s the painful  bones and joints - I feel 90! I am swimming and going to yoga which helps but it’s when you stop and sit still!  I had grade 2 stage 2 with an oncotype score of 20 so avoided chemo (I’m 49). I hope the chemo goes well fir you and let us know which drugs you end up on and how you’re doing. Xx
Posts.Title: Exercising after treatment

Posts.Content: Thank you. I have read many of your posts and find them comforting.  Will post on the main sit xx
